page.title: 13Geography and Ecology
page.content: Edenbridge and the surrounding area is mainly on Wealden clay. The highest point is 93 metres above sea level and the lowest point is 45 metres above sea level.As the clay is impervious there are numerous ponds and streams. These support lots of plants such as Water- lilies; birds such as coots and mallards and insects such as Pond Scatters and dragon flies. The area is quite rich in wild life. Birds, animals, plants and trees flourish very well. This shows that the soil can support plenty of wild life and is ideal for farming. There are lots of cultivated plants and trees such as Pines. The industry in Edenbridge does not support much wild life apart from the sewage works which is a rich source of wild life especially birds.
